block.p: Cristin Hayes Callaghan, the daughter of Mary Ann and Richard S. Callaghan of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., was married yesterday to Andrew Christopher Fellingham, the son of Janet and Andrew V. Fellingham of Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Mark C. Hallinan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

Ms. Callaghan, 25, is keeping her name. She is the publicity coordinator for the Museum of Television and Radio in New York. She graduated from Boston College, as did the bridegroom. Her parents are figure skating coaches in Bloomfield Hills. Her father coached Tara Lipinski in 1998, when she won a gold medal in the Nagano Olympics; he is also Todd Eldredge's coach.

Cristin Hayes Callaghan, the daughter of Mary Ann and Richard S. Callaghan of Bloomfield Hills, Mich., was married yesterday to Andrew Christopher Fellingham, the son of Janet and Andrew V. Fellingham of Garden City, N.Y. The Rev. Mark C. Hallinan performed the ceremony at the Roman Catholic Church of St. Ignatius Loyola in New York.

Ms. Callaghan, 25, is keeping her name. She is the publicity coordinator for the Museum of Television and Radio in New York. She graduated from Boston College, as did the bridegroom. Her parents are figure skating coaches in Bloomfield Hills. Her father coached Tara Lipinski in 1998, when she won a gold medal in the Nagano Olympics; he is also Todd Eldredge's coach.

Mr. Fellingham, 26, is an assistant vice president and money-market trader in New York for Commerzbank, the German commercial bank. His mother is a secretary at the Center for Disabilities, a school in Williston Park, N.Y. His father retired in April as the deputy chief executive in North America for Bank Austria in Greenwich, Conn.
